sn22.71:4.2: Then Venerable Rādha went up to the Buddha …
sn22.71:4.4: “Sir, how does one know and see so that there’s no ego, possessiveness, or tendency to conceit for this conscious body and all external stimuli?”
sn22.71:4.5: “Rādha, one truly sees any kind of form at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; coarse or fine; inferior or superior; far or near: all form—with proper wisdom: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
sn22.71:4.7: One truly sees any kind of feeling …
sn22.71:4.10: consciousness at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; coarse or fine; inferior or superior; far or near: all consciousness—with proper wisdom: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
sn22.71:4.13: That’s how to know and see so that there’s no ego, possessiveness, or tendency to conceit for this conscious body and all external stimuli.” …
sn22.71:4.14: And Venerable Rādha became one of the perfected.
